pr_title: Support for non-api mediaccc links, invidious shortened links, refactor mediaccc tests

timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: Instead of this, just do urlString.startsWith("https://media.ccc.de/b/") (and preferably change the name of the urlString variable back to just url)

replies.bodyText:
Yes it's conferences @TobiGr

timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText: Why are you catching that FoundAdException? getId doesn't even throw that.
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: my bad. because I used the same piece of code of youtubestreamlinkhandlerfactory and yeah, it's thrown on ad. I removed it.
replies.author: B0pol

timeline.bodyText: As far as I know this is not good practice, an empty List should be returned instead. Though I am not sure if it is normal to see null instead of empty lists in NewPipeExtractor. Same 5 lines below
timeline.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it be a better idea to use substring? That's what we want, in the end
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText:
You can notice I didn't changed anything here, just the parameter name.
Anyway, I've done it, if I understood your request
replies.author: B0pol

timeline.bodyText: In these stream tests you should also check if all stream urls are secure urls (i.e. start with https://)
timeline.author: Stypox
Stypox

timeline.message: MediaCCCLH: use substring instead of replace; improve a bit tests, return Collections.emptyList(); instead of null where it's annotated @NonNull
check wether mediaccc streams url are secure
check wether mediaccc streams url are secure
